result.execSummary:
The defendant Antoine D Morton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).
  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: AS TO ALL COUNTS: Credit for 102 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes:
AS TO ALL COUNTS:
Pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution.
No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause. No illegally controlled substances. Random screening.
Court advises defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

AS TO ALL COUNTS: Court orders defendant to provide DNA sample and pay surcharge, if not already done. Pay costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against defendant and subject to other collection. Court orders DOC to collect all monetary amounts at the rate of 25%.

***5-27-2015, Judge Watts; Court ordered the $250 DNA surcharges on counts two and three are VACATED. The defendant's motion to vacate the $250 DNA on count one is DENIED.***

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antoine D Morton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order as to Counts 1, 2 & 3 signed and filed.  Copies mailed to the defendant and the State./ds
records.descr: Petition for sentence adjust denied-public interst

records.addlTxt: Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Daniel L. Konkol, Br. 44, for review. mag
Counts one, two and three.
Partially Granting Motion to Vacate DNA Surcharges, signed and filed. Copy sent to the defendant. sab
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. J.D. Watts, Br. 15, calendar successor, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se motion to vacate DNA surcharge.
Original Transcript PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING  (51 pages) commencing APRIL 11, 2014 received and filed.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 618

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) no illegally controlled substances; 4) random screening; 5) seek and maintain employment. 

COURT ORDERS:
- DOC to collect all monetary amounts at the rate for a total of 25%; 
- defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the DNA surcharge if not already done.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant.  

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Count 1:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 4 years with 102 days credit; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 2 years; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 2 years; pay costs, assessments  and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Count 2:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 4 years with 102 days credit; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 2 years; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 2 years - concurrent with Count 1; pay costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Count 3:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 4 years with 102 days credit; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 2 years; EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 2 years - concurrent with Count 1; pay costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to Counts 1, 2, & 3 and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 1, 2 & 3 as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Defendant Antoine D Morton in court with attorney Mathew M Meyer.  Defendant Antoine D Morton in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Amended Information received and filed.   The amendement applies to only the codefendant on Count 4.  Defense acknowledges receipt of the copy of the amended information and waives reading.

Defendant Antoine D Morton in court with attorney Mathew M. Meyer.  Defendant Antoine D Morton in custody.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Court adjourns motions in limine.  State agrees cases should be severed for jury trial.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Antoine D Morton in court with attorney Mathew M. Meyer.  Defendant Antoine D Morton in custody.  Nathaniel Emery Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Amended Criminal Complaint received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of a copy of the Amended Complaint.   Hearing on motion to suppress due to insufficient search warrant proceeds.  Arugments by counsel.  Sworn-in for the defense: Antoine Morton; Exhibit #1 marked, identified, offered and received into evidence.  Defense rests.  State rests.  Testimony closed.  Arguments by counsel.  Court makes findings of fact.  Court finds the defendant had some expectation of privacy on 12-30-14.   Court finds it was reasonable to conclude the evidence they were looking for was in the location as described and does provide sufficient facts as could be drawn from them that contraband could be found at that residence.  Court denies defense motion.
State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Suppress Evidence received and filed./ds
Defendant's Motions in Limine and Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Evidence (Illegal Search-Insufficient Search Warrant) received and filed./ds
State's Motion in Limine received and filed./ds

Attorney Mathew Meyer in court, defendant Antoine D Morton not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E. Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests motion hearing. Defense motion due by 3/14/2014 and the state to respond by 3/28/2014.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 4, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 1-13-2014 received and filed. (15 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Attorney Matthew Meyer 135 W Wells St  #214 Milwaukee WI  53203

Attorney Mathew Meyer in court, defendant Antoine D Morton not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E. Adamson for Karen Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Bail argued by counsel.  Court AMENDS bail to $50,000 cash and removes Justice Point monitoring.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Antoine D Morton in court with attorney Mathew Meyer.  Defendant Antoine D Morton in custody.  Denis Stingl for Karen Ann Loebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Michael Wawrzyniakowski-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 44.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for January 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 16, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CO-DEF:  RANESHIA MERRITT.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Antoine D Morton in court with attorney Louis E Epps.  Defendant Antoine D Morton in custody.  Nathaniel E. Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge KONKOL, Branch 44.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
